page.title: 05F of D Forestry Commission
page.content: {Coleford}is the{administration {headquarters}for the{Forestry {Commission}in the{Forest of Dean.Work} for the area is co-ordinated here and it is a place where information about {forestry}can be obtained.The {Commission}works an area of{31,382 {acres}roughly balanced between {deciduous}and{coniferous trees,some of this being waste land left from past industrial use.In{1972 22,000 tons of {coniferous timber and 15,000 tons of {hardwood}was cut.The Deputy {Gaveller's Office is housed in this {building. Applications for free mining to obtain a{'gale'of coal}are made here.If you are born in the{Hundred of {St.Briavels}and have worked for a year and a day in a mine then you are able {to mine yourself.
